vision.notes: Sensory capabilities of this flatworm family are largely unknown from the provided context. Further research is needed to determine if they possess eyespots or other light-sensing organs.

chemoreception.notes: As parasitic flatworms, Cathetocephalidae likely rely on chemoreception to locate and identify hosts. This is inferred from the general lifestyle of parasitic flatworms.

mechanoreception.notes: Mechanoreception is likely present, allowing the flatworms to sense touch and water currents, important for attachment and movement within the host environment.
